ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to build characters for my short stories, and how to build the stories around the characters. Also, how to engage in a creative writing workshop
My writing improved a lot, as did my ability to critique other students's work. Developed a strong and lovely community of writing friends

Just having time to write fiction was really useful and all of the feedback that I received was well-thought through and insightful. Because it is such a small class, the people in it are really invested which makes it such a good class.

Incredible lessons in narrative arcs, character construction, and harnessing the imagination, featuring the occasional smattering of honest and very practical advice about careers and further study in English. You will experience truly phenomenal improvement as a writer under Cazs tutelage no matter what your starting point is.
How to write fiction, what to look for when reading fiction, importance of character development, plus a lot of talks about postgrad opportunities (MFA programs, traveling, editing, etc)
The craft of fiction writing; critical analysis of others' work

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The strength of a workshop like this is not just about improving my craft. Its also about learning how other writers think, reflecting on what I can learn from their writing, and getting to know them as talented, interested humans.

People were very direct about giving critical feedback. It was somewhat stressful during the workshops, but ultimately it was very rewarding and helped me improve my stories.

It's like many other creative writing workshops. Pieces are workshopped every week and edits are due two weeks after your workshop. Only real weakness I can think of is that the turnaround time for writing comments on pieces was quite short, only a day and a half, which made it hard to provide comprehensive feedback, especially if that day just happened to be busy. Might be better to have a longer period for that.
I loved this class -- I looked forward to it every week! I don't know what, if anything, could be improved!
Strengths are Caz and the people you are in workshop with!! Listen to them, learn from them, you'll grow as a writer
I appreciated that the course was not only focused on writing/workshopping but also had lessons about craft and how to approach a story.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely take this course if you get in! The most valuable thing from this course is the structured time devoted to just writing two short stories, amidst everyones crazy Yale schedule. Clear feedback from both Caz and everyone in the class. Cool group of writers and humans.

Yes. Caz has given some of the most helpful feedback Ive ever received in a creative writing course at Yale, and combined with his British-isms like calling us you lot, my time in the course was delightful.

Yes! 100 percent! Such a good class, it has always been highly recommended to me and I would highly recommend it to anyone interested in writing fiction -- even if you don't have much experience doing so.

Wholeheartedly. If you get into this class, or anything with Caz for that matter, you have to take it. He is one of a kind. This workshop is so rewarding - there is nothing more special than having your work dissected and improved by a table full of awesome Yale writers as well as one of the most accomplished moderators/editors/writers you will find in the department.
Absolutely!!! Take it with Caz, he is so cool and builds lasting connections with each student in the class.
I would recommend this course to anyone who enjoys the workshop format or hopes to to improve their fiction writing, especially their short story writing
